item.title: The Alters: Gifting Guide
item.description:
Running your base of operations smoothly in The Alters requires a lot of work. Not only will you need to keep all your alters fed, give them work to do, and maintain all the structures and items in the base, but you will also need to try to make the alters as happy as possible.

There are several ways to do this in The Alters . And the easiest way to give any upset alter a boost is to give him a present in the form of personal effects that have been scattered around the maps.

How Gift Giving Works in The Alters

As you wander around the different maps, you can find a variety of objects around. These include organics, metals, movies, and personal items that were scattered all over the planet when your pods crashed. If you pick up all these items, you will be able to give them as presents to whichever alters you make first in The Alters , and each gift given will help to smooth any fighting between you and your clones.

The way gift giving works is that you pick up objects outside, then you give them to raise the alters' happiness in The Alters ; you can see where each alter is currently hanging around in the upper left-hand part of the screen. Then, you can interact with each alter and see if it's an item they want. Gifts cannot be given to alters that won't like them . This means if the option to give the gift is available when interacting with the alter, it's a good gift for them.

All Cargo Drop Locations in The Alters

There are several locations in the Prologue and the Acts for these drops. These will contain one of three things: personal items, movies to watch in the Social Room, or Qubit chips. The items you receive in personal cargo drops is somewhat random; it appears that you will only get good gifts for the alters you actually have in your party currently, though this needs more testing to be sure.

Cargo Drop Locations in the Prologue

There are two Cargo Drop locations in the Prologue; one contains gifts and the other has a movie in it.

Cargo Drop Locations in Act 1

There are several locations for cargo drops in Act 1 of The Alters , all marked below. The green star is a broken chip while the others are personal items and movies.

Cargo Drop Locations in Act 2

Coming soon.

Cargo Drop Locations in Act 3

Coming soon.

5 Images

item.title: How to Start the NieR DLC in Stellar Blade (Emil Location)
item.description:
The complete edition of Stellar Blade includes two DLC expansions. Players will be able to start the Nikke DLC fairly early on in their playthroughs, although they may need to wait a bit longer before they can sink their teeth into the NieR content, as doing so will require them to find Emil.

Initially released back in November of 2024, the NieR: Automata DLC adds several new NieR -inspired outfits and cosmetics for Stellar Blade to track down. The following guide will explain how to start the NieR DLC and what exactly players can expect to get out of it.

How to Start the NieR DLC in Stellar Blade

To start the NieR DLC, players will need to have gained access to the Wasteland, which happens around three hours into the game's main story. Once there, they should keep their eyes peeled for Emil, who can be found driving around near the Junkyard supply camp . It's then just a case of shooting his vehicle, which will trigger the start of Stellar Blade 's NieR expansion. Players can also find Emil driving around in the Great Desert just to the east of where the Tetrapod drops them off or to the north of the Exhile's Passage supply camp near the elevator to Xion.

All Nier DLC Outfits in Stellar Blade

Stopping Emil will grant access to his shop, although players won't be able to purchase any of the cosmetics that he sells there without first getting their hands on some Stellar Tears. Stellar Tears are a new type of currency that players can find scattered around the Wasteland and the Great Desert, with fifteen available in total. After finding them all and buying everything from the shop, Emil will stop showing up for good.

Item

Cost

YoRHa No.2 Type B Uniform (Outfit)

2 Stellar Tears

2 Stellar Tears

FAQ

Q: How Do You Start the NieR DLC in Stellar Blade?

Players can start the NieR DLC by shooting Emil's van, which can be found driving around in three pre-determined locations across the Wasteland and the Great Desert.

item.title: Palia: The True Treasure Quest Guide
item.description:
The hunt for Prismbeard's treasure continues in Palia 's The True Treasure quest. It's another Discovery Quest in the Prismbeard Treasure questline that reveals more about the legendary, geometric-bearded pirate's backstory and leads to some bountiful rewards. However, it can be a tricky and lengthy quest to complete, with numerous riddles to solve and locations to find across the Elderwood map.

If you're struggling with what to do in Palia 's The True Treasure quest, this step-by-step walkthrough guide tells you how to solve each puzzle leading to each Prismbeard statue, plus how to solve Prismbeard's final puzzle at the end of the treasure hunt to grab some well-earned rewards.

Palia: The True Treasure Quest Guide

How To Start The True Treasure in Palia

To start The True Treasure in Palia , you must first complete the preceding two quest s in Prismbeard Treasure's questline introduced in Palia 's Radiance Rising update, as follows:

  • Adventure On the Horizon
  • Prismbeard's Lost Treasure

The True Treasure quest unlocks as soon as you complete Prismbeard's Lost Treasure, continuing the search for the mysterious pirate fortune. Completing The True Treasure in Palia involves following and ticking off the objectives below, beginning with a chat with Caleri, the local librarian:

Ask Caleri About Prismbeard, Then Return To Auni and Nai'o

The first objective in The True Treasure is to ask Caleri about Prismbeard , who Auni and Nai'o think could know more about Prismbeard's life. If you're already at Elderwood, you can use one of Elderwood's fast travel stables to return to Kilima Village to find Caleri, who you can sometimes, but not always, see in the Library Restricted Section next to the Furniture Store. Doing so gives you a set of Prismbeard Newspaper Clippings with clues about his life, which you'll need to refer to in solving the quest's various riddles to find each Prismbeard statue in the treasure trail.

To check and read the Newspaper Clippings from Caleri again, click the exclamation mark in your inventory to access the Quest Pouch . If playing Palia on a PC, press the right mouse button to select the 'Read' option, enabling you to refer back to the clippings any time you need to check the information. These give you details about Prismbeard's life, plus pictures of different locations across the Elderwood map where you can find Prismbeard statues that give you a clue to the next statue location .

Before embarking on Palia' s The True Treasure quest, it's also best to check if you have the Pirate Spyglass equipped from Prismbeard's Lost Treasure quest. This is because it reveals each Prismbeard statue and the strange, purple patterns that surround them. If you unequip the Spyglass, you won't be able to see either the statues or their purple trails.

Where To Find Prismbeard's Childhood Home

The first riddle, marking the beginning of the treasure hunt, is to find Prismbeard's childhood home . Page one of the Newspaper Clippings tells you that Prismbeard was 'born and raised in the forest just outside of Zendruu Outpost.' Additionally, page two also shows a picture of the shack where Prismbeard and his brother grew up.

If you're familiar with the Elderwood map, you'll note that Zendruu Way is an area that leads to Mauvais Way . Starting at the Elderwood Central Stables, follow the Red Blossom Cave tunnels until you reach the cliffs at point A-4 on the map, where you can find a Prismbeard Statue on the cliffs as shown in the video below. Interact with the statue to reveal the next clue, then speak with Auni nearby to discuss it, indicating the next step is to find where Prismbeard sailed his first ship :

After interacting with each Prismbeard statue, you'll need to locate and speak with Auni, Palia 's resident Bug Catcher, to report what you've found, who will be standing not far from each statue with Nai'o. After doing so, the quest updates with the next objective in the treasure hunt. Although you might stumble across the statues randomly, you also need to interact with them in the correct order.

How To Find Where Prismbeard Sailed His First Ship

To find where Prismbeard sailed his first ship , you need to search for a small pond with a wooden dock , as shown in the photo on page four of the Newspaper Clippings. Specifically, you can find it at point F-6 on the Elderwood map between Red Blossom Cave and Lilac Cavern , as shown in the video below. Once again, interact with the Prismbeard statue on the dock, then speak to Auni to get the next clue, which means to look for where Prismbeard first set sail.

How To Find Where Prismbeard First Set Sail

To find where Prismbeard first set sail , head to point B-8 on the Elderwood map at De Mer Dock , as hinted at on pages five and six of the Newspaper Clippings. If you travel straight to De Mer Dock stables, you can find the Prismbeard statue just left of the De Mer Dock fast travel location .

As before, interact with the statue, then talk to Auni, who you can find standing with Nai'o just in front of the docks.

How To Find Where Prismbeard Was Caught

The next step is to find where Prismbeard was caugh t, which is located at point F-4 on the walkways above the Elderwood Central Stables . This is hinted at on pages seven and eight of the Newspaper Clippings. You can reach the Prismbeard statue there by climbing the central structure near the Central Stables fast-travel location . Head around the walkway to find the next Prismbeard statue and interact with it, as shown in the video below. Afterward, chat with Auni below to get the next clue to look for, which is where Prismbeard escaped.

How To Find Where Prismbeard Escaped

To find where Prismbeard escaped , the next stop on the list is point G-2 at Mitana Grove , as hinted at in the picture on page 10 of the Newspaper Clippings. Look for the pier at Mitana Grove to find the next Prismbeard Statue on the hexagonal-shaped dock .

Interacting with the statue , followed by speaking with Auni standing nearby, reveals the final location to check - Eobard's Revenge , which is the name of Prismbeard's ship .

Where To Find Eobard's Revenge

Lastly, to find Eobard's Revenge , you need to head back to Shipwreck Cave , which you can find inside the Hidden Cave at point D-8 on the map. To get there quickly, use the Mitana Grove Stables to fast travel to De Mer Dock, then head to the Hidden Cave on the right of the cliffs by the southwest Red Blossom Cave entrance.

Once inside, you can find Prismbeard's Ship overlooking the central Shipwreck Cave area. However, there's another Prismbeard Statue to find located on the steps up the nearby slope , then speak with Auni nearby.

This time, interacting with the statue unlocks the door to the Secret Cave , which is the door surrounded by purple glowing patterns, as pictured above. Head inside the Secret Cave to find the final step in The True Treasure - Prismbeard's final puzzle!

How To Solve Prismbeard's Final Puzzle And The True Treasure Quest Rewards

The final step in The True Treasure quest is to solve Prismbeard's final puzzle inside the Secret Cave doorway you just unlocked. To solve the final puzzle, you must turn each circular dial to display the correct symbol in the right direction , as described in the numbered surrounding scrolls on the ground. Afterward, press the purple button nearby to check your guess , as follows:

Clue

Image

Direction

1

Charybdis

West

2

Leviathan

South

3

Siren

North

4

Kraken

East

Although you can use your compass in the top-right of the screen to check which direction is north, it can still be a tricky puzzle to get right. If you're struggling, the video below shows exactly what to do to solve the final puzzle and unlock the nearby door leading to Prismbeard's treasure and your rewards:

If you're unable to loot the treasure chest for any reason, try emptying your inventory bag slots first and, if necessary, reloading the area. Doing so should enable you to loot Prismbeard's treasure chest if you encounter any problems doing so.

When looting Prismbeard's treasure chest , you'll get the following rewards :

  • Prismbeard's Journal
  • x1 Emerald
  • x1 Garnet
  • x1 Pearl
  • x2 Gold Bars
  • Prismbeard's Figurehead
  • +15 Renown

Afterward, speak to Auni to complete Palia 's The True Treasure quest, which ends on a note that's all about the true meaning of treasure.

Palia
8.6 /10
Released
August 10, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Singularity 6, Inc.
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PC

item.title: 8 Best Open-World Games with Intricate Mysteries to Solve
item.description:
Summary

  • Open-world games like Paradise Killer offer intricate murder mysteries in eye-catching settings.
  • L.A. Noire and Disco Elysium provide deep detective experiences with intriguing storylines.
  • Games like Subnautica and Outer Wilds challenge players to solve mysteries while surviving.

Many of the best-designed open-world games are packed full of secrets to uncover, as players gradually explore their expansive settings and unravel the many mysteries hidden within. Whether its an outright detective game with crimes to solve, important characters with mysterious backstories, or simply an enigmatic location waiting to be discovered, there are some fascinating mystery-filled worlds available on the market.

Those who have a thirst for conundrums and enjoy the freedom of discovering an open world are spoiled for choice with some of the best games ever made. Anybody wishing to crack some perplexing puzzles and find out the truth in some intriguing situations should play these open-world games with intricate mysteries waiting to be solved.

8 Paradise Killer

Solve A Murder Case On Paradise Island

6 Images
6 Images
Paradise Killer
8.0 /10
Released
September 4, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Kaizen Game Works
Publisher(s)
Fellow Traveller
Platform(s)
PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Nintendo Switch, Xbox One, Microsoft Windows
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Among the best whodunits ever made, Paradise Killer features everything from aliens and alternative realities to brutal mass murders. Containing one of the best and most creative stories in video games, players take the role of the exiled Lady Love Dies, a detective who is the only one capable of discovering the truth behind the sinister plot on Paradise Island 24.

Lady Love Dies can bring the accused to trial at any time, but its generally more effective to explore the 24th iteration of the island to gather as much evidence as possible and talk to everyone who may have valuable information to share. There is much more to this mystery than the mass murder of the entire Syndicate Council, but anyone who takes it on can expect plenty of humor and quirkiness.

7 The Sinking City

Staying Sane While Oakmont Is Flooding

The Sinking City
4 /10
7.5 /10
Released
June 27, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Frogwares
Publisher(s)
Frogwares
Platform(s)
PS4, Xbox One, PC, Switch, PS5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Fair
Powered by

Set during the 1920s in Oakmont, Massachusetts, The Sinking City puts players in the role of private investigator, Charles W. Reed, as he gradually loses his sanity and the city becomes submerged during unprecedented flooding. Inspired by the works of H.P. Lovecraft, there are plenty of otherworldly and terrifying creatures that plague the inhabitants of this struggling metropolis.

At times, its hard to tell the difference between reality and hallucination as Reed battles to manage his mental health and investigates the various goings-on in each of the citys districts. These areas can be traversed in many ways, and there are multiple approaches to cases, meaning that players can replay the game several times to achieve different results.

6 L.A. Noire

Solve Cases And Uncover A Wider Conspiracy

L.A. Noire
8 /10
9.4 /10
Released
May 17, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Team Bondi
Publisher(s)
Rockstar Games
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4, Xbox 360, Xbox One
Powered by

While working his way through the various bureaus of the police department in post-war Los Angeles, Cole Phelps tackles many head-scratching cases. Not only are there the main story missions in L.A. Noire , where Phelps investigates everything from burglaries and arson to brutal murders, but a wider conspiracy is gradually uncovered involving many powerful individuals in the city.

Over a decade since its initial launch, L.A. Noire is still one of the most intriguing worlds to explore, and investigating crime scenes can make players feel like real detectives. Interrogation scenes can sometimes be a bit ridiculous for those with more modern graphical sensibilities, but they were revolutionary for the time, and the wider mysteries of the game are still compelling today.

5 The Forgotten City

Figure Out What Is A Sin

The Forgotten City
8.0 /10
Released
July 28, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Modern Storyteller
Publisher(s)
Dear Villagers
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Starting life as a mod for Skyrim , The Forgotten City was massively overhauled and fleshed out into a fully-fledged game on its own. This is one of those games where no two playthroughs are the same. Players are repeatedly sent back in time to the year 65CE in a cursed Roman city, where they must speak to its inhabitants and prevent the citys demise.

The Golden Rule dictates that if one citizen commits a sin, then the entire population turns to gold as a punishment. The definition of sin is somewhat ambiguous, however, with each character having conflicting opinions on the matter, so its up to the player to try different actions and witness the results as they learn more and more information. These details unlock new opportunities and outcomes in future loops.

4 Outer Wilds

Explore A Solar System Before It Is Destroyed

Outer Wilds
9.2 /10
Released
May 28, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Mobius Digital
Publisher(s)
Annapurna Interactive
Platform(s)
PS4, Xbox One, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Every 22 minutes in Outer Wilds , the star at the center of the freely explorable solar system goes supernova and destroys everything, restarting the 22-minute time loop again. In each run, the player must visit the various planets, interact with their inhabitants, and discover alien ruins, any of which may hold the secrets behind this endlessly repeating phenomenon.

The planets are constantly changing over each 22-minute cycle, meaning that players will need to visit and revisit certain locations in different runs beforeor after specific events occur, helping to discover invaluable information (the only carry-over from cycle to cycle). Staying alive is itself something of a challenge, since oxygen is a limited resource, space is full of volatile locations, and miscalculations of trajectory can see the spaceship fly off into the abyss.

3 Subnautica

Discover The Cause Of An Alien Civilizations Demise

Subnautica
13
9.2 /10
Released
January 23, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Unknown Worlds Entertainment
Publisher(s)
Gearbox Publishing
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

After crash landing on an oceanic planet, Ryley Robinson must survive and thrive alone on the enigmatic planet 4546B. While exploring this underwater world in Subnautica , Ryley discovers remnants of an advanced alien civilization and the existence of a mysterious disease called Kharaa, with which he is now infected.

The mysteries and solutions are gradually uncovered by venturing out further into the deep to discover more information, but with close attention being given to survival. Naturally, oxygen and sources of nutrition are a major concern, so building a secure base and gathering resources is crucial, but there are also plenty of terrifying sea creatures to either avoid or eliminate with appropriate weaponry.

2 Horizon Zero Dawn

Who Is Aloy, And What Caused The Downfall Of Humanity?

Horizon Zero Dawn
Adventure
RPG
Systems
Released
February 28, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Guerrilla Games
Publisher(s)
Sony
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Featuring an expansive open world where each region has its own cultural identity, Horizon Zero Dawn contains many intricate mysteries waiting to be unraveled. Set in the 31st century in North America, humanity lives in fragmented tribes across the ruins of the old world, which is heavily populated by massive and dangerous animal-like machines.

The protagonist, Aloy, is something of an enigma herself, being an orphan with no real understanding of her origins. Her backstory, along with what brought the world to this point, are the two main mysteries to figure out while surviving and exploring this fragmented and tribalistic world. The deep lore and satisfying combat make the Horizon series a must-play for any fans of interesting scifi stories don't skip the audio logs in this one!

1 Disco Elysium

Investigating A Murder As An Amnesiac Detective

Disco Elysium
9 /10
12
9.6 /10
Released
October 15, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
ZA/UM
Publisher(s)
ZA/UM
Platform(s)
PC, PS5, PS4, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Stadia
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Disco Elysium begins with player-character Harry du Bois waking up with drug and alcohol-induced amnesia. Playing more like a tabletop RPG than a traditional role-playing game, Harry and his colleague Kim Kitsuragi are detectives tasked with solving a murder in the world of Elysium, which has over 6000 years of complicated history.

Gameplay consists of skill checks rather than traditional weapons-based combat, and players are free to take it on in their own way with 24 completely unique skills to develop and plenty of options in the Thought Cabinet. There are six possible endings, depending on the choices made in various interactions, but either way, its many conundrums and layers of complexity are sure to stick with even the most hard-boiled aspiring detectives long after reaching the credits.

item.title: 8 Open-World Games That Adapted To Fan Feedback
item.description: It may be unfair to expect perfection from these titles, but fans expect their favorite titles to shoot for the moon and reach even greater heights.
